hours_text:
#  Tickets

__

$ 10 Per Adult

__

$7 Youth (ages 3-17)  
$7 Student with ID  
$7 Senior (ages 60+)

__

FREE for Members  
[Become a Member >](https://nbm.org/visit/membership/)

**Advance-purchase tickets for Thursday through Monday, 10 am to 5 pm. Tickets include access to all Museum exhibitions.**

[ Purchase Tickets Now __](https://nbm.ticketapp.org/portal/pages/purchase_tickets)

Tickets are not required to visit the Great Hall or the [Museum Shop](https://secure2.convio.net/nbm/site/Ecommerce?store_id=1161&VIEW_HOMEPAGE=true&FOLDER=0&TYPE=&NAME=).

####  Ticket Information:

  * After you purchase your tickets, watch for a confirmation email.
  * When you arrive at the Museum, proceed to the Visitor Center to pick up your wristband.
  * Museum Member, Student, and Senior ticket holders must present a valid Member Card or ID to redeem wristbands.
  * Tickets cannot be refunded or exchanged. They are valid only for the date specified.

accessibility_text:
#  Accessibility

The National Building Museum provides a variety of accessibility services for visitors.

Wheelchair and stroller access is located at our G Street NW entrance. For after-hours programs, use our 4th Street NW entrance via the parking lot. If you are in need of a wheelchair upon arrival, during normal business hours, visit the Information Desk to inquire. Elevators are centrally located on the north and south walls of the building. The Museum’s exhibition galleries and other public spaces are designed in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act.

### Parking Accessibility

The National Building Museum does not provide parking for visitors. However, the D.C. Department of Transportation provides [disability parking options](https://ddot.dc.gov/page/disability-parking) on street throughout the Museum’s immediate neighborhood. Local public transportation options such as Metro also provide services and accommodations for those with disabilities. [Visit WMATA’s website to learn more about these services](https://www.wmata.com/service/accessibility/).

### Sign Language

American Sign Language interpretation is available for Museum programs with two weeks’ notice. Please call us at 202.272.2448 to schedule interpretation, or for other accessibility questions.

collections_text:
#  The world we design & build.

__

Open Thursday - Monday, 10am - 5pm

__

401 F Street NW, Washington, DC

__

Metro: Judiciary Square

[ Plan Your Visit __](https://nbm.org/visit/)

##  On View

[ View All Exhibitions __](https://nbm.org/current-exhibitions/)

[](https://nbm.org/exhibitions/building-stories/ "Building Stories")

###  Building Stories 

Building Stories brings kids and adults alike on an immersive exploration of the world of architecture, engineering, construction, and design found in the pages of children’s books.

[](https://nbm.org/exhibitions/brick-city/ "Brick City")

###  Brick City 

Brick City celebrates iconic architecture from cities around the world through carefully recreated constructions made from LEGO® bricks by U.K.-based artist Warren Elsmore. 

[](https://nbm.org/exhibitions/mini-memories/ "Mini Memories")

###  Mini Memories 

Mini Memories presents selections from a one-of-a-kind collection of souvenir buildings, on display to the public for the first time.

[](https://nbm.org/exhibitions/house-home/ "House & Home")

###  House & Home 

House & Home is a kaleidoscopic array of photographs, objects, models, and films that take us on a tour of houses both familiar and surprising, through past and present, challenging our ideas about what it means to be at home in America.

[](https://nbm.org/exhibitions/visible-vault-open-collections-storage/ "Visible Vault: Open Collections Storage")
